node_2: top 10 most-listened songs chart by raaga.com

node_2: top five hindi film albums of the year
edge: Chitralekha magazine featured the soundtrack in their listing of 'Top Five Hindi Film Albums' of the year.
The use of Indian instruments and rich choral accompaniment is prominent and pleasing to classical music buffs, especially because of Ghoshal's tuneful voice.
Darbar's compositions in the album are classical-based.
Badr's lyrics in the album are very rich.
Ismail Durbar has made attempts to blend classical music into his tunes, but because of his dependence on and usage of familiar tunes, the music lacks freshness.
Darbar has once again weaved magic and done an admirable job here in creating divine music.
Darbar did a commendable job with the compositions.
